newsitem.title: UK: Superscape shares hit by sales shortfall.
newsitem.headline: Superscape shares hit by sales shortfall.

text.p: Shares in virtual reality group Superscape VR Plc dropped on Monday after the company posted a heavy first-half loss and said sales had proved slower than many in the industry had predicted.
The often-volatile stock was down 42-1/2p at 347-1/2 by 1340 GMT, though no trading was recorded.
Pre-tax losses rose to 3.1 million stg in the six months ended January 31 from 0.9 million a year before, on turnover which rose to 1.9 million stg from 1.6 million.

The company said it was "difficult to anticipate with any degree of precision the rate of takeup for emerging technologies" but that it expected investments to start reaping returns in the next six to 18 months.

Superscape said its increased losses reflected sales and marketing expenditure in repositioning itself from a pure virtual reality company to one offering interactive 3D facilities on the world-wide web.

"Armed with a range of products which are widely acknowledged to be the best in their field, a clearly defined strategy and a tight rein on costs, Superscape with seek to move towards profitability in the financial year 1997-1998," it said.
New lower-cost authoring tools are to be introduced later this year, targeting small-to-medium sized businesses wishing to build 3D web pages.
